newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil's Sadia closes small soybean crushing plant.
newsitem.headline: Brazil's Sadia closes small soybean crushing plant.

text.p: Brazilian food processor Sadia has closed one of its smaller soybean crushing units to improve profitability, a company spokeswoman said.
The unit in Campinas, Sao Paulo state, had a crushing capacity of 400 tonnes per day and represented only five percent of total production, she added.
Other units would now crush the soybeans which would normally have been processed at the Campinas plant, the spokeswoman said.
She declined comment on whether the company would be considering closing other plants in the near future.
-- Caroline Bulloch, Rio de Janeiro newsroom, 5521 5074151
